intro: Dionysia cespitosa, commonly known as the clustered Dionysia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in dense clusters along the stems. Dionysia cespitosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
